body:
Mark, is that you? :-) I am able to import the .blend file just fine using [open3mod](http://open3mod.com), which runs on assimp 3.1. It is possibly related to a recent fix in the blender importer. Can you try with 3.1?

Thanks!

I get the same error with open3mod, ie: the scene fails to load with the same error as above. Very strange! Uninitialized memory perhaps?

I'm using Windows 7 64-bit, and have tried both assimp 3.1.1 and the latest github 'master' branch with my own project.

Ok, had a closer look at this and I'm now thoroughly confused!

The bit that's failing is this (in BlenderLoader.cpp):

```
    if (mesh->totface > static_cast<int> ( mesh->mtface.size())) DIE_DIE_DIE!
```

totface is correct (ie: 6) but mtface is empty.

The mface vector is correct though (ie: size=6) and appears to be created by bmesh convertor converting MPolys to Mfaces via AddFace() method.

But AddFace only adds MFaces, not MTFaces, so it's not too surprising mtface is empty. What is surprising is that it works for you!

I'm not sure this issue is completely fixed. It seems to have shifted the failure downstream, and I'm now seeing failures in BlenderBMeshConverter::ConvertPolyToFaces. In particular, 

```
const MLoopUV* loopUV = &BMesh->mloopuv[ poly.loopstart ];
```

it's assumed that |mloopuv| is non-empty, which doesn't appear to always hold (see [this mesh](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By954vGxxCmFSUZrbGRsTEJqODg/edit?usp=sharing) for an example failure). It's possible the issue here is unrelated, in which case I'll file a separate bug.
Actually, I can repro this with the included regression test model, https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/master/test/models/BLEND/blender_269_regress1.blend.
Sorry for the noise, it appears the issue exposed in BlenderBMeshConverter::ConvertPolyToFaces may be unrelated, and had existed before the fix from @apetrone

issue.title: Convert demo model to .blend and .fbx, remove Qt dependency

repository.name: glexamples
repository.description: cg examples using globjects and glbinding

issue.body:
I couldn't convert our demo model to a blend-file that assimp is able to load. However, it could be loaded using the assimp-based open3mod-tool (see also: https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/325).

The solution for us in order to import light sources as part of 3d models is to export the model from blender to .fbx.

We are also not supposed to depend on Qt in our painter, but we can use the texture loader included in gloperate (which is based on Qt behind the scenes)

body:
I just ran into the same exact issue - created a cube, texture mapped it, saved, opened it with Substance Painter and got "BLEND: Number of UV faces is larger than the corresponding UV face array (#1)"

So, if it's a bug, it's still there (I realize it's been a while). It might be that a simple cube isn't setup quite right either, but although I'm not a CGI artist I don't see anything obviously wrong with it.

issue.title: Blender UV problem

repository.name: SuperBMD
repository.description: A library to import and export various 3D model formats into the Binary Model (BMD) format.

issue.body:
I tried to import various .blend files with the program, but every time i tried to import a file with at least 1 UV map, there would be an error that said:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24947776/34805893-46343838-f64e-11e7-95d6-3d50e1fb570a.png)
what do?
